contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 12, 1998 D Harry Ramsden's Section 'A' Contest Final
Harry Ramsden's Section 'A' Contest (Final) 0 Entertainments Contest
harry-ramsdens-contest Harry Ramsden's 70th Jubilee Brass Band Masters
Harry Ramsden's, Guiseley Winner takes all prize - £1000
In order to celebrate their 70th birthday the famous fish and chip restaurant chain held eight Regional Championships, culminating in a two-day brass band festival featuring an invitation Masters for Championship Section bands competing for prize money totalling £9000. Eight brand new banding regions were created around Harry Ramsden's restaurants at which nationally graded 1st and 2nd Section bands competed in a specially devised Section 'A'. Regional winners went on to battle it out for a 'winner takes all' prize of £1000 in a Grand Section 'A' Final. The Section 'A' Champion was then invited to compete in Harry Ramsden's 70th Jubilee Masters the following day where the winning band took home £5000, with the second and third bands receiving £2500 and £1500 respectively.
Feb. 22, 2011, 3:13 p.m. Jan. 8, 2013, 4:28 p.m.
1 Pontardulais Town Band C. Brian Buckley
2 Todmorden Old Band Dennis Hadfield
3 Kibworth Band Ian Scott
4 Aldbourne Band David Williams
5 Longannet Colliery (Cowdenbeath) Thomas Wyss
6 Spennymoor Town Band Neil Davies
7 Chiltern Hills Brass Philip Sparke
Withdrawn Ashton Band Martyn Evans
